p: Soxhlet is globally the most used lab-scale technique for fat and oil extraction. However, it is time- and energy-consuming and also uses important amounts of petroleum-based solvents, mainly n-hexane [ 18]. As mentioned above, the latter is ranked high on the hazardous solvents list. Consequently, many research groups over the years have investigated new alternatives [ 4]. In this context, bio-solvents such as terpenes have gained a great deal of attention as they can potentially offer a renewable alternative to these solvents [ 34].
